ALLEGATION:
Youth's room had holes in the wall, torn mattress, and water puddle on the floor. It is
unknown how long the room was in this condition for. Staff member appeared
intimidating towards youth and reported youth to be destructive, but incident reports
have not reflected this. There has not been treatment implemented based off this
behavior either. There are concerns regarding age-appropriate expectations of this
youth.
INVESTIGATION:
The complaint was received on 10/05/2022, via online agency complaint.
I interviewed Staff 1 on 10/06/2022 at the facility. Staff 1 is the family transitional
coordinator assigned to Youth A. She is not aware of any recent incident reports
involving Youth A. She reported Youth A has a history of being destructive and
punching holes in the walls. She said the last incident report she has for Youth A is
dated 09/15/2022, when Youth A punched the van window. She is not aware of any
holes in the bedroom walls, or hole in the mattress. She reported the bedrooms were
painted last weekend and maintenance was cleaning the floors. She said Youth A
has never expressed any concerns regarding any staff members.
I interviewed Therapist 1 on 10/06/2022 at the facility. Therapist 1 meets weekly with
Youth A for individual therapy, and group therapy. Therapist 1 reported Youth A has
been making progress and is more engaging in therapy, but he does struggle with
change. In therapy she focuses on his behavior and improving impulse control. She
said the beginning of the school year is a trigger for Youth A. She is not aware of
recent incident reports for Youth A being destructive. She said staff will document
and report incidents involving a youth being destructive. Youth A has not reported
any concerns regarding any issues or concerns regarding staff.
I interviewed Youth A on 10/06/2022 at the facility. Youth A initially did not want to
talk or answer the questions and said that he is too embarrassed. He admitted to
making a hole in the mattress and said that he usually covers the mattress so that
staff did not see the hole. He was asked about the water on the floor, and he again
said he is “too embarrassed” and did not want to talk about it. He denied being
intimidated by Staff 2 or having any concerns or issues with staff members. He
reported staff help him with cleaning and organizing his room. Youth A said he has
weekly individual and group therapy, takes his medication daily, and feels safe. He
expressed no issues or concerns regarding staff or the facility.
I interviewed Staff 2 on 10/06/2022 at the facility. Staff 2 is a youth specialist is
assigned to Burnham Cottage. She is familiar with Youth A and was working 2nd shift
on 09/27/2022. Staff 2 said that she did not notice the hole in the mattress or the
water on the floor in Youth A’s bedroom. She said staff usually help the youths clean
611 W. OTTAWA • P.O. BOX 30664 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/lara • 517-335-1980

and organize their bedrooms in the evening before they go to bed. She denied any
recent incidents involving Youth A being destructive or damaging his bedroom. Staff
2 said if Youth is being destructive, an incident report is completed and submitted to
the supervisor. She said Youth A is very messy, but staff do help and work with the
youths on cleaning and organizing their rooms.
A walk-through Burnham cottage was completed on 10/06/2022. Youth A’s bedroom
was observed, the mattress has been replaced. There were four dime size circles on
the wall of the bedroom where the paint was peeled off. There were no holes in the
walls. The room was found to be clean, and neat. The cottage bathrooms, kitchen,
and living room were observed and found to be clean.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Specialist via telephone on 10/10/2022. She
reported on 09/27/2022 she picked up Youth A for an off-site visit with his sibling.
When they returned to the campus, she went to Youth A’s bedroom. She observed a
puddle of water on the floor, the mattress had a hole in it, there were clothes on
floor, and one wall had several areas where the paint was pealed off. She said
Youth A told her he had flipped the mattress, so staff didn’t see it. She was
concerned about the tone the Staff 3 spoke with Youth A about his room being
messy and that he is very destructive. Foster Care Specialist said Staff 3 told her
that she has known Youth A for five years, which she found to be strange since
Youth A has only been at the facility for 2 years.
I interviewed Staff 3 on 10/12/2022 at the facility. Staff 3 is a youth specialist and
has been working at the facility for 5 years. She reported no disciplinary
actions/reports. Staff 3 was working 2nd shift on 09/27/2022 and recalls the incident
involving Youth A. She denied previously seeing the hole in Youth A’s mattress or
the water on the floor. Staff 3 said Youth does have a history of being destructive,
but she was not aware of any recent incidents. She admitted to talking to Youth A,
about him being destructive, but denied that her tone was intimidating. She said staff
help Youth A clean and organize his bedroom daily. Staff usually will go and check
youth’s rooms before they go to bed and help them fold their clothes and clean the
room. She tries to always be positive and motivate all the youths when addressing
any issues or concerns. She said staff will document and complete incident reports
whenever there are any incidents involving the youths. She said Youth A was not in
the cottage when she arrived for her shift and so staff did not have a reason to go to
his room. Staff 3 denied saying she has known Youth A for five years. She told
Youth A’s foster care worker that she has worked at the facility for five years. She
said they helped Youth A clean his room that night and replaced his mattress.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 at the facility on 10/12/2012. He has been working at the
facility for almost two years and is the Supervisor for Burnham Cottage. Supervisor 1
reported all the youths got new beds and mattresses in August. He said staff were
not aware of the hole in the mattress or the water on the floor. He reported the
cottage had been painted the weekend before this incident and maintenance was
cleaning the floors the day before this incident. He said staff help all the youths clean
611 W. OTTAWA • P.O. BOX 30664 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/lara • 517-335-1980

and organize their bedrooms. Staff complete daily checks on all the cottages and if
there is anything that needs fixing, they fill out a form and give to him to send to
maintenance. He reported the same for incident reports, noting staff are to complete
an incident report regarding any incident involving the youths. He said Staff 3 has a
good relationship with all the youths and he has never witnessed her being
intimidating while interacting with the youths.
I interviewed Staff 4 at the facility on 10/12/2022. Staff 4 is the maintenance
supervisor and has been working at the facility for seven years. He reported
Burnham cottage was painted on 09/25/2022 and on 09/26/2022, he went to
Burnham cottage and cleaned the floors. He said the floors were cleaned, and dried.
He denied leaving puddles of water on the floors.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident report dated 09/15/2022, property destruction, Youth A pushed on
the vehicle window.
• Incident report dated 07/13/2022, verbal aggression, Youth A became
verbally aggressive with staff and started throwing items around his bedroom.
He tried to break the window in his room.
• Incident report dated 07/11/2022, property destruction. Youth A was
argumentative with staff about chores. He was kicking, slamming things and
broke several windows.
• Incident report dated 06/24/2022, property destruction. Youth A got caught
drawing inappropriate pictures on the bathroom wall. Youth A ran out of the
cottage and began hitting the cottage window with a stick.
• Youth A’s Treatment Plan dated 06/15/2022 through 09/11/2022. Youth A
receives weekly individual therapy focused on understanding the relation
between thoughts, emotions, and behavior, as well as improving impulse
control. Youth A also receives weekly group therapy.
• Reviewed facility’s policy for reporting and documenting critical incidents.
• Staff 3 employee file reviewed: No disciplinary action.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4138 Bedding and linen.
(1) Each resident shall be provided with an individual bed
with a clean pillow, mattress, and sufficient clean blankets.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found compliant with the rule. Staff interviewed
were not aware that the youth’s mattress had a hole in it. The
facility had replaced all the beds and mattresses in the cottage
in August of 2022. Youth reported he’s embarrassed and said
that he covers his mattress so that staff do not see the hole in
the mattress. The facility immediately responded when they
611 W. OTTAWA • P.O. BOX 30664 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/lara • 517-335-1980

were made aware of the damaged mattress and replaced it with
a new mattress.
CONCLUSION: Violation Not Established
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4407 Facility and premises maintenance.
(5) Floors, interior walls, and ceilings shall be sound and in good
repair and shall be maintained in a clean condition.
ANALYSIS: The facility is compliant with the rule as it could not be
determined where the water on the floor came from. Youth A
was interviewed and said he was “too embarrassed” and
refused to answer questions about the water on the floor.
CONCLUSION: Violation Not Established
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
ANALYSIS: The facility is compliant with the rule as there is insufficient
evidence that the staff member spoke with youth in an
intimidating manner. Youth A denied being intimidated by staff
and did not express any concerns or issues with any of the staff
at the facility.
CONCLUSION: Violation Not Established
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan.
(3) The updated treatment plan shall include all of the
following information:
(c) Changes in the treatment plan, including new problems
and new goals to remedy the problems. Indicators of goal
achievement and time frames for achievement shall be specified
611 W. OTTAWA • P.O. BOX 30664 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/lara • 517-335-1980

along with a specific behavior management plan designed to
minimize seclusion and restraint and that includes a continuum
of responses too problem behaviors.
ANALYSIS: The facility is compliant with the rule as evident by the interview
with therapist and review of Youth A’s treatment plan. Youth A
treatment plan was reviewed, and he receives weekly individual
therapy focused on understanding the relation between
thoughts, emotions, and behavior, as well as improving impulse
control.
CONCLUSION: Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on the findings of this investigation, I recommend no change to the current
license status.
